definition.ISO:639:3:eng: This is the namespace for built-in types and structures.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace is reserved for default terms and descriptors, user terms and descriptors must have a custom namespace.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace contains an empty string in the global identifier, this will make the first character of any global identifier that uses this namespace a colon :. Since global identifiers cannot be empty, it will not be possible to duplicate this namespace.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default domains, domains define kingdom categories for objects in this system.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Domains can be considered as taxonomy kingdoms, they provide a high level generic category that represents the root of the object definition hierarchy,

example.ISO:639:3:eng: The dictionary domain contains several collections, such as terms, descriptors and schemas.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default collections, a collection is a container of objects grouped by data structure similarity, belonging to the same domain.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A collection is both a definition and a reference to the physical database collection. Each collection stores objects based on a degree of data structure similarity, while the other categories may group objects based on other criteria.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: The terms collection is used to store enumerations, categories, data types and other term instance types, an enumeration instance belongs to the terms collection, which belongs to the dictionary domain.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default instances, an instance is a classification that defines the different types of object instances.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: An instance identifies a specific class of objects stored in the database. There is a one to one relationship between an instance and a specific type of object, this means that two different instances may share the same class structure. It is recommended not to create a hierarchy of instances.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: An enumeration instance will have a reference to the collection in which enumerations are stored, it will contain references to classes, structures and properties that define the data structure of an enumeration, and will be available via a controlled vocabulary under the category referencing the enumerationâ€™s domain.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default categories, a category is classification term that can be applied to object instances.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: An object instance can be further classified into several categories, this classification represents the leaf element of the domain tree: domain, collection, instance and category.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default sets of enumerated values that represent valid choices lists.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: An enumeration is a list of references to elements belonging to the same collection that represent the domain of valid choices from which a value must be selected.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: The list of ISO 3166 countries is an example of an enumeration: a country variable may be set to only allow values coming from that list.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default classes, classes are used to represent data structures that may be shared among instances, or that may represent shared object sub-components.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A class can be used to provide the data definition of an object instance, of a structural entity contained in different instances, or of a structural entity from which different instances can be derived. A class defines a data structure without taking the object function into account.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: The terms class contains data definitions that are common to enumeration, category and descriptor instances, the latter three are distinct instances and are stored in different collections (descriptors have their own collection) and they all share the same domain..

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default structures, a structure represents a complete data structure.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A structure is structurally identical to a class, but it exists under the convention that only root structures can be used by classes and instances. A structure may be the subclass of another structure, but only the root structure can be the subclass of an instance or class. This rule is not programmatically enforced, it is up to who designes the structure to follow this rule.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: When you want to reference recursively data structures it is a good idea to assign a structure to a property, rather than assigning a class to another class.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default form definitions, a form is a structure that holds the list of fields used to implement input and output user interface screens.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A form is similar to a class: the class defines what information is stored in the database, while the form defines what information is exchanged between the system and the users.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default kinds, a kind is a category above the type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The relationship between kind and type is similar to the relationship between collection and instance: the kind determines the broad functional class of an item, while the type determines the specific function of the item.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: One example of a kind is the data kind, such as quantitative or categorical.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default types, a type is the most specific function definition of an item.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Types in this system are enumerations, categories, classes and all

example.ISO:639:3:eng: One example of a type is the data type, such as string, number or date.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default formats, a format determines the shape of a data element.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The format is used as a modifier in a data type to define a list or set of elements of the given data type.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A descriptor of text data type may be made into a list of text items by indicating the list modifier in the format property.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default ranks, a rank determines the hierarchy of an itemt.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The rank is applied to users, it determines what kind of resources the user has access to in the application.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A user with rank standards can access standards and user created objects, but cannot access default or system resources.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default roles, a role is a specific function that a user is allowed to perform.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Each user has a set of roles that determine which actions the user is allowed to perform in the application.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A user may upload datasets only if the user record has the upload role.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default units, a unit is a standard measure.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The unit is used to indicate the measurement standard of values stored in a specific descriptor.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: Gram, kilogram or meter are unit examples.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all default languages used in the application.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Default identification and naming attributes namespace.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all items that have the function of providing identification and naming discrimination to objects.
This namespace groups all items that represent authentication properties and attributes.
This namespace groups all items that represent definitions or descriptions.
This namespace groups all items that represent events.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Default status and state information namespace.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This namespace groups all items that represent status information.
This namespace groups all items that represent validation rule properties and attributes.
This namespace groups all items that represent statistical and summary information.
This namespace groups all terms and properties related to directed graph edges.
This namespace groups all terms that define the type of relationships.
This namespace groups all items that are neither default or standard components.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: All items added to default or standard components will be added under this namespace.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary groups all domain types, domain types qualify domain groups.
This domain type groups objects under functional categories.
This controlled vocabulary groups all domains.
This domain groups all terms that have the function of defining dictionary structures and views. Data types, classes, forms and controlled vocabularies belong to this domain.

This domain groups all objects that represent geographic items, such as locations, administrative units, toponyms, shapes and the relationships between these elements. The elements of this domain are shared in different contexts, so they should be considered as standards.
This domain groups all objects that represent users, their actions and authentication information.
This domain groups all objects that represent system resources, procedures and attributes. These include, user management, settings and other system specific functions.
This domain groups all objects that represent data studies, their original datasets and annex documents.
This domain groups all objects that represent a data collection.
This domain groups all objects that represent data from survey datasets.
This enumeration collects the main instance categories that any object may take. This represents the root instances domain.
This enumeration collects all the different term types, each term object belongs to one or more of these categories.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A term may have an enumeration iinstance when it is used as the root of a controlled vocabulary and it may also have a selection instance when it is used as an enumeration choice.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration collects all the different descriptor types, each descriptor object belongs to one of these categories.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A text and a string descriptor both belong to the text field instance; an integer and a real number descriptors both belong to the number field instance.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: List of graph relationship object instances.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration collects all the different types of edge objects, each edge belongs to one of these categories.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The discriminating factor for this category is both the scope and the key structure of the edge: the scope determines what domains the edge relates, while the key structure indicates which elements of the edge are used to uniquely identify the object.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A schema edge is an object that relates data dictionary elements, that resides in the schemas collection and that uses its predicate, in addition to the relationship nodes, to uniquely identify the object. An edge attribute object relates data dictionary and geographic elements, it resides in the edges collection and is uniquely identified by the related nodes, the predicate and its attributes.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This category applies to all objects that represent geographic entities.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: Geographic instances are toponyms and shapes.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: List of user related object instances.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration collects all user related object instance types.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: User documents, groups, sessions and logs belong to this category.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration collects all system related object instance types.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: Errors and messages belong to this category.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration collects all data related object instance types.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: Studies, annexes and datasets belong to this category.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Namespaces are terms used to disambiguate identifiers.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Any class that conforms to the term identification protocol, that is, has a global identifier (gid), can be used as a namespace.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Templates are directed graph term nodes that will not be recorded when traversing the structure, their function is to collect a set of child elements as if these were directly attached to the parent node.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A template can only have this instance category, it cannot be used as other types of instances. In general, templates will hold sort field information to change the inherited sort order, but not appear as a tree node.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Enumerations are terms that define controlled vocabularies.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: An enumeration is a directed graph structured as a tree that implements a nested controlled vocabulary, the object is the term that defines the root element.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A selection is a term representing a controlled vocabulary element.
A category is a term of a controlled vocabulary that is used as a header or group, but that is not a valid selection.
A collection is a term that defines a data collection.
An instance is a term that defines a specific object type instance.
A term that defines a generic data type.
A term that defines a text data type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A text data type may provide the regular expression validating the text value and the length bounds of the string.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A term that defines a quantitative data type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A quantitative data type represents a measure that may include range bounds.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A predicate is a term that defines the type of a relationship.
A class is a term that defines a data structure.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A class is a data structure definition that can be shared both as a super-class or component of an object data structure definition.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A structure is a term that groups a collection of descriptors.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A structure is a data structure definition that is complete and does not depend on classes.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A form is a term that defines an input/output data exchange form.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A form is a structure definition for an interactive input or output screen, it defines what information is exchanged between users and the system.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A generic value definition.
A value definition of type text or string.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent text values.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of type key or variable.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent text value that are used as object keys.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of type URL or e-mail.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent references to internet resources.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of type XML, SVG or HTML.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent encoded text values.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a hexadecimal string.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category applies to hexadecimal values.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a date and/or time.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent dates or time stamps.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a generic number.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent numeric values.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a boolean.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent boolean values.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a generic range.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent ranges.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of an object reference.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent generic object references.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a term reference or enumeration.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent term references.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a descriptor reference or enumeration.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent descriptor references.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of an array or list of heterogeneous values.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent lists and sets.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a data structure.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent structured data.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: A value definition of a generic mapped structure.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This category collects all data types that represent structures with enumerated keys.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a non branched dictionary edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This type of edge resides in the schemas collection, it relates terms and descriptors among each other and links geographic items to terms.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a non branched dictionary edge instance identified by the source, destination, predicate and attributes.
This is a branched dictionary edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate, featuring a required branches list and eventual modifiers structures.
This is a non branched toponym edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This type of edge resides in the edges collection, it relates geographic items among each other and links terms to geographic items.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a non branched toponym edge instance identified by the source, destination, predicate and attributes.
This is a branched toponym edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate, featuring a required branches list and eventual modifiers structures.
This is a non branched link edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This type of edge resides in the links collection, it relates data items among each other.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a non branched link edge instance identified by the source, destination, predicate and attributes.
This is a branched link edge instance identified by the source, destination and predicate, featuring a required branches list and eventual modifiers structures.
User records contain authentication and other user properties.
User group records contain properties common to a set of users.
Users are managed by other users, this instance indicates the user manages other users.
A system log entry is a record describing a system event.
System messages are enumerated communication strings expressed in different languages.
Sessions contain information regarding an open user session.
Settings contain global configuration options.
A study is an entity collecting a series of documents, such as reports, datasets and questionnaires, associated with a distinct project or initiative in a specific time frame and region.
Annex documents are the collection of all documents comprising a study.
SMART methodology survey dataset collection.
This controlled vocabulary lists all collection kinds.

This controlled vocabulary contains the available list of collections. Collections organise all data into the database. Each collection contains a predefined set of class instances. The enumeration is divided into collection categories.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: This collection stores user credentials and information.
This collection stores user groups information.
This collection stores system configurations and settings.
This collection stores user log information.
This collection stores all system messages in all languages.
This collection stores current user sessions.
This collection stores data study annex documents.
This collection stores controlled vocabularies and structure schemas.
This collection stores relationships between objects other than controlled vocabularies and schemas.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The collection stores all directed graph edges that do not represent data dictionary, and geographic element relationships.
The collection stores all directed graph edges that represent hierarchies between data dictionary elements; this mostly concerns relationships between users and user groups.
This controlled vocabulary contains all the available data kinds for descriptors, these classifications provide information on the kind of data.
Data of this type does not represent a quantity, it is descriptive and cannot be categorised.
A categorical property is one which can take on one or more of a limited, and usually fixed, number of possible values from an enumerated set of choices.
An ordinal property provides information on the position of an item in a hierarchy or list, such as a hierarchical level or sort order.

A discrete property is one which may take an indefinite number of values, which differentiates it from a categorical property, and whose values are not continuous, which differentiates it from a quantitative property.
A quantitative property is one whose type of information is based in quantities or else quantifiable data, these are in general numerical values which can be aggregated in ranges.
This controlled vocabulary contains the list of all base data types, these correspond to the data types from which the value types are constituted.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A data type is an abstract definition for a data type, descriptors define a value type which is a hierarchy of data types.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data can be of any type.
Data can be true or false.
Data is a text string.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
Text value types have the following modifiers:
  • length: minimum and maximum number of characters.
  • regex: validating regular expression.
  • range: minimum and maximum string value range.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data represents a numeric value.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
Numeric value types have the following modifiers:
  • range: the range to which a value must belong.
  • round: the number of decimal positions.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data is a <em>list<em> of values.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
Array value types have the following modifiers:
  • size: minimum and maximum number of elements.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data is an object whose properties must be defined by descriptors.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Structures are objects containing a set of key/value pairs, the key corresponds to a descriptor and the value is the descriptorâ€™s value. This data type should not have custom data validation fields, since its contents are expected to be standard descriptors. This data type cannot feature the object's type type-key and type-value fields.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data is an object whose properties can be of any type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Structures are objects containing a set of key/value pairs, the key can be any string and must be unique within the object and the value can be of any type. This data type supports two validation fields: type-key and type-value, if provided, they respectively represent the key and value data types. Both fields are structures containing the type field that holds the data type, and an optional set of other fields that add options to the data types.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary contains all the types that values associated with descriptors can take. Each value type is associated to a hierarchy of data or value types which together provide all the necessary information on the value format.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A value type is a type associated with a descriptor, these types are constituted by a hierarchy of data types.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Data is a list of unique values.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
Set value types have the following modifiers:
  • size: minimum and maximum number of elements.
It is implied that the elements of a set must be unique.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A string that references an object key field.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The string references another pbjectâ€™s key field, except its _id field.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This type is used to collect reference-related validation options such as the list of enumerations or the collection in which to locate the referenced object. All types that reference _key or gid fields of other objects derive from this type. References to _id fields do not have options and are not in this type hierarchy. Since it is used as a base type, to inject validation options, this type cannot have default options.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Values are numbers expressed in hexadecimal notation.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A link to an internet resource.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Values are URL internet links.
Values are text formatted in XML notation.
Image encoded in Scalable Vector Graphics format, this type of image is vector based, so it doesn't depend on resolution.
Values are text formatted in HTML notation.
Values are strings that cannot exceed 255 UTF-8 characters.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A string that can be used as a record identifier.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The string cannot contain spaces, it allows a subset of punctuation and it must be anon-empty and up to a length of 254 characters.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A string that can be used as a local identifier.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The string cannot contain spaces, it allows a subset of punctuation and it must be anon-empty and up to a length of 64 characters.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A string that can be used as a variable name.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The string must be alphanumeric, non-empty and up to 64 characters long; it allows the use of underscores.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A date in which the day, or the day and month may be omitted.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Values are a date in YYYYMMDD, YYYYMM, or YYYY format.
Values are e-mail addresses.
This field contain the reference to a document in the database, it contains the _id of the requested document which can reside in any collection of the database.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Use this type when the value is an _id.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contain the reference to a document in a collection, it contains the _key of the requested document, the collection is required.
This field contain the reference to a document in a collection, it contains the gid of the requested document, the collection is required.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Reference to a term stored in the database

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a reference, _key, to a term stored in the database, any object stored in the terms collection is valid.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Reference to a descriptor stored in the database

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a reference, gid, to a descriptor stored in the database, any object stored in the descriptors collection is valid.
Values are numbers without decimal points.
Values represent a specific date and time, these are implemented as a numeric timestamp indicating the number of milliseconds elapsed since the UNIX epoch, January 1st 1970 00:00:00.000 UTC.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A minimum and maximum number of elements.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Values represent a range between a minimum and maximum bound in which it is possible to indicate whether the individual bounds are included or excluded from the range, this data type applies to elements count, thus its numeric values must be integers.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
This data type is implemented as an array of 4 elements:

  1. Minimum bound, of range, integer.
  2. Maximum bound of range., integer
  3. Minimum bound included flag, boolean: true includes minimum, false excludes it.
  4. Maximum bound included flag, boolean: true includes maximum, false excludes it.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Values represent a range between a minimum and maximum bound in which it is possible to indicate whether the individual bounds are included or excluded from the range.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
This data type is implemented as an array of 4 elements:

  1. Minimum bound, of range, numeric.
  2. Maximum bound of range., numeric
  3. Minimum bound included flag, boolean: true includes minimum, false excludes it.
  4. Maximum bound included flag, boolean: true includes maximum, false excludes it.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a list of unique strings.
This data type is a structure that implements the GeoJSON standard. All the elements of the structure follow the standard, while the properties structure must contain valid descriptors.

note.ISO:639:3:eng:
The geometry properties are implemented as a structure with two elements: type, which holds a string that indicates the shape type and coordinates, which holds an array with the coordinates of the shape vertices.

Available shapes:

  • Point: A single position. The coordinates field holds an array of two floats: [longitude, latitude].
  • MultiPoint: The coordinates field holds an array of Point coordinates.
  • LineString: A line. The coordinates field is an array of two [longitude, latitude] arrays providing the start and end positions of the line.
  • MultiLineString: The coordinates field holds an array of LineString coordinates.
  • Polygon: A polygon. The coordinates field contains nested arrays which represent the polygon points starting from the exterior and including eventual holes. The top array contains the rings, the rings contain an array of [longitude, latitude] points which represent the contour of the ring; the first and the last coordinate must be the same.
  • MultiPolygon: The coordinates field holds an array of Polygon coordinates.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary indicates how data type values are shaped. Values can be scalar, which indicates a single value of the provided data type; list, which indicates a list of values of the provided data type; set, which indicates a set of unique values of the provided data type and struct which indicates a structured type.
A single value.
An array of values.
An array of unique values.
This controlled vocabulary contains the available measurement units. The list is divided into measurement type categories.
This controlled vocabulary contains the available languages in which labels and descriptions are available.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: The class of predicates used in controlled vocabularies.
The class of predicates used in structure schemas.
The class of predicates used in forms.
The class of predicates used to represent a function.
The class of predicates used to represent an attribute.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: In a controlled vocabulary directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node is a template or namespace. Edges with this predicate do not require a branch and the source node will be skipped.
In a controlled vocabulary directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node does not represent a legal choice, but it represents a category or group.
In a controlled vocabulary directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents the type of the destination node
In a controlled vocabulary directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents a legal choice.
In a structure schema directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents the superclass of the destination node.
In a structure schema directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents a property of the destination node.
In a form directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents the parent form of the destination node.
In a form directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents a field of the destination node.
In a structure schema directed graph this predicate indicates that the source node represents an attribute.
In a structure schema directed graph this predicate indicates that the destination node represents the GeoJSON shape of the source node.

Predicates of this type indicate that the destination of the relationship is the endorsed choice, this means that the destination of the relationship should be used instead of the source of the relationship.
This predicate indicates that the destination of the relationship is an instance of the relationship source. This type of predicate is generally used to indicate term instances.

This predicate indicates that the destination of the relationship represents the domain or type of the relationship source. This type of predicate is generally used to record how terms are being used, it provides information on the different contexts in which an abstract term is used.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Each time an object is instantiated in a particular context or function, the system will create a relationship between the domain of the context and the term that was used as the instance. For instance, if a term was used as a namespace, this field will add the namespace class to this set.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Term used by or used in.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This predicate indicates that the relationship source is used by or in use in the relationship destination.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: User or group is managed by.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This predicate indicates that the relationship source is managed by the relationship destination.
This predicate indicates that the relationship destination is the group to which the relationship source belongs to.
This controlled vocabulary lists the main object classes.
This is a structure that represents a namespace.
This is a structure that represents a controlled vocabulary template. Templates are not valid enumeration types, but they can be used as templates to implement valid controlled vocabularies.
This is a structure that represents a controlled vocabulary.
This is a structure that represents a controlled vocabulary element.
This is a structure that represents a controlled vocabulary category.
This is a structure that represents a data collection.
This is a structure that represents an object instance.
This is a structure that represents a generic data type.
This is a structure that represents a text data type.
This is a structure that represents a quantitative data type.
This is a structure that represents a predicate.
This is a structure that represents a class.
This is a data structure that represents exclusively its members and does not represent a class.
This is a structure that represents an input form.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Descriptor schema for generic data type.
Descriptor class for URLs and e-mails.
Descriptor class for XML, SVG and HTML documents.
Descriptor class for dates and time stamps.
Descriptor class for generic numbers and integers.
Descriptor class for floating point numbers.
Descriptor class for descriptor descriptor references.
Descriptor class for text enumerated maps.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is an edge with a predicate.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The edge key is computed by calculating the MD5 hash of the following fields in order: _from, _to and predicate.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is an edge with a predicate and a list of attributes.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The edge key is computed by calculating the MD5 hash of the following fields in order: _from, _to, predicate and attributes.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is an edge with a predicate, list of branches and eventual branch modifiers.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The edge key is computed by calculating the MD5 hash of the following fields in order: _from, _to and predicate; the record contains a required branches list and an eventual modifiers structure associated to branches.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Base class for geographic and administrative units.
Base class for study annex documents.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary classifies forms by their fscope.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Form used for providing data to the system.
Form used to provide data from the system.
Input/output form applying to a specific instance.
Input/output form applying to more than one instance.
Input/output form applying to data not related to instances.
This input/output form provides comprehensive information.
This input/output form provides partial information.
This type of form provides summary information in a card format.
This type of form provides information in a list line format.
This type of form provides information in an expandable point format.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The login form is used to retrieve the user code and password in order to authenticate the current user.
This form is used to create the system administrator user.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The system administrator must be the first user in the database, if any other user exists in the system, it will be forbidden to create the system administrator. While for creating other users there must be a currently logged in user with user management, in this case this is not required.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The creation form is used by the manager to create the user into the system, an e-mail notification will be sent to the newly created user that will use the regirstration form to complete the information and login to the system.
The registration form is used to log into the system a user for the first time.
The credentials form is used to update the userâ€™s personal information.

This controlled vocabulary contains the available list of image types. This classification groups images by utilisation: it indicates whether the image is to be used as a thumbnail or as the default display format.
This controlled vocabulary contains the available list of levels that apply to user roles.
This enumeration represents a role whose credentials include system resources, users with this role level can manage all resources.
This enumeration represents a role whose credentials include default resources, users with this role level can manage all resources except system level resources.
This enumeration represents a role whose credentials include standard resources, users with this role level can manage all resources except system and defaults level resources.
This enumeration represents a role whose credentials include users resources, users with this role level can manage all resources except system, defaults and standards level resources.
This enumeration represents a guest role, users with this credentials level are not allowed to manage system, defaults, standards and user level resources.
This controlled vocabulary contains the available list of user role functions. Each element represents a specific function that can be performed by users.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: This role allows users to to create, modify and delete users.
This role allows users to to schedule and manage batch procedures.
This role allows users to to upload datasets into the system.
This role allows users to to curate dataset metadata.
This role allows users to to match and clean uploaded datasets.
This role allows users to to suggest new descriptors during the harmonisation process.
This role allows users to to curate the data dictionary..
This role allows users to to determine when the dataset harmonisation process is complete and store the final dataset.
This role allows users to to query the data repository.
This role allows users to to download the results of data repository queries.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary indicates the implementation level of the object to which the choice is applied. It defines whether it is implemented by the system, as a default item or as a public standard.
The item is a system provided resource, it can only be modified by system level data dictionary curators.
The item is a default resource, it can be modified or deleted by default data dictionary curators, user and standard level curators cannot change its value.
The item is a public standard, it can be modified or deleted by standard level data dictionary curators, user curators cannot change its value.
The item is user-defined, it can be modified or deleted by user level data dictionary curators.
This controlled vocabulary indicates the status of the object to which the choice is applied. It defines whether the item was proposed, under revision, or if it is disabled.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: A missing status indicates that the item is valid and usable.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: The item is not yet initialised.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The item is not yet in its final form, it is not disabled, but it has to be validated before being used.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This status is generally used to qualify new users: a pending user is one that has just been registered with the signup service, but has not yet been validated through the signin service.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The item was proposed by a user, its implementation will be decided by a curator.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This status is similar to the pending status, except that in this case the item can be used with reservations.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The item is implemented, but it is currently under revision.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This status indicates that the item is valid and usable, but that it is under revision, which means that it may be disabled in the future.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The item has been disabled and should not be used.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This status indicates that, while the item exists, it should not be used.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary indicates the restrictions applying to the current item. It defines whether the item is reserved to the system, if it can be viewed, but not modified, and if it cannot be modified once it has been created.
The item is reserved to the system, it cannot be viewed, modified or deleted by users.
The item is reserved to the system, it can be viewed, but not modified or deleted by users.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: The item can only be appended to.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Once the item has been created by the user, elements cannot be deleted, but they only can be appended.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This is generally used in enumerated sets to indicate that existing members cannot be deleted, but that additional members can be added.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Once the item has been created by the user, it cannot be modified or deleted.
This controlled vocabulary indicates the usage policy applying to the current item. It indicates whether the item is required, suggested, or if it is optional.
The item must be provided by the user.
The item should be provided by the user if applicable.
The item is a possible option.
The item should not be used.
This controlled vocabulary indicates how the item is going to be presented to the user, it determines whether the user can provide a value or if the item is display only.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This controlled vocabulary is used in form definitions to indicate the behaviour of the form fields: it determines whether the fields are modifiable by the user or if they are only displayed to the user.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Interface options for forms.
A list of form fields that will not constitute a sub-form when used as a form member of another form.
A list of form fields that will become a sub-form when used as a form member of another form.
Interface options for form fields.
If the rank and roles are compatible, the user may provide or modify the value; if the rank and roles are not compatible, the value will be hidden and unavailable to the user.
If the rank and roles are compatible, the user may provide or modify the value; if the rank and roles are not compatible, the use may only view the existing value.
If the rank and roles are compatible, the field will be displayed to the user; if the rank and roles are not compatible, the value will be hidden.

If the rank and roles are compatible, the field value will be computed depending on the contents of other fields and will be displayed to the user; if the rank and roles are not compatible, the value will be computed, but hidden from the user.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: The field is computed and modifiable.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: If the rank and roles are compatible, the field value will be computed depending on the contents of other fields and will be provided to the user who may modify its contents; if the rank and roles are not compatible, the value will be computed, but hidden from the user.
The value will be provided to the form, but the user will not be able to view or modify it.
This controlled vocabulary contains the default attributes that can be assigned to items.
The attribute indicates a shape that represents a point or coordinate.
The attribute indicates a shape that represents a border or outline.
The attribute indicates a shape in low resolution.
This controlled vocabulary indicates in which direction the enumeration or structure is traversed.
This indicates that the siblings point to the root node.
This indicates that the root node points to the siblings.
This indicates that the relationship is not directional.
This enumeration contains the list of cast function references, these are used in validation to cast values to the correct base type.
This element references the string cast function.
This element references the number cast function.
This element references the boolean cast function.
This element references the hexadecimal cast function.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will first cast the value to a string and then set it to lowercase: this is to allow correct string matching.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This enumeration contains the list of custom validation function references, these are used in validation to handle cases that cannot be managed by Joi validation.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Joi validation will assert the value structure and contents, however, other validation steps are needed to, for instance, ensure that a value is a correct object reference: this enumeration contains the list of such function references.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate URLs.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the uri Joi validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate hexadecimal strings.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the hex Joi validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate integers.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the integer Joi validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate e-mail addresses.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the email Joi validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate range range fields dates.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the four element data types to the Joi array validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate size range fields.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the four element data types to the Joi array validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate GeoJSON structures.
This element references the function that will validate string dates.
This element references the function that will validate time stamps.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The function will add the timestamp Joi validator.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This element references the function that will validate object references in the form of an object _id.
This element references the function that will validate object references in the form of an object _key in a specific collection.
This element references the function that will validate object references in the form of an object gid in a specific collection.

This element references the function that will validate instance references in the form of a term _key: it will check if the provided key in the provided collection is an instance of the provided instance.
This namespace is used for descriptors and terms that do not have a specific authority, or that aggregate elements from different standards.
Neighbouring country or geographic and/or administrative region.
This predicate indicates that the relationship source is a geographic or administrative unit of the relationship destination.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Codes for the representation of names of scripts.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Codes for the representation of names of scripts, defines two sets of codes for a number of writing systems (scripts). Each script is given both a four-letter code and a numeric one. Script is defined as "set of graphic characters used for the written form of one or more languages". (source Wikipedia)

ISO 3166-1 is part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and defines codes for the names of countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest. The official name of the standard is Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions â€“ Part 1: Country codes. (source Wikipedia)

SO 3166-2 is part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and defines codes for identifying the principal subdivisions (e.g., provinces or states) of all countries coded in ISO 3166-1. The official name of the standard is Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions â€“ Part 2: Country subdivision code. (source Wikipedia)

ISO 3166-3 is part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and defines codes for country names which have been deleted from ISO 3166-1 since its first publication in 1974. The official name of the standard is Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions â€“ Part 3: Code for formerly used names of countries. (source Wikipedia)

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: ISO 4217 language family and groups codes.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: ISO 4217 is a standard first published by International Organization for Standardization in 1978, which delineates currency designators, country codes (alpha and numeric), and references to minor units. (source Wikipedia)

ISO 639-1:2002, Codes for the representation of names of languages â€” Part 1: Alpha-2 code, is the first part of the ISO 639series of international standards for language codes. Part 1 covers the registration of two-letter codes. There are 184 two-letter codes registered as of October 2015. The registered codes cover the world's major languages. (source Wikipedia)

ISO 639-2:1998, Codes for the representation of names of languages â€” Part 2: Alpha-3 code, is the second part of the ISO 639 standard, which lists codes for the representation of the names of languages. (source Wikipedia)

ISO 639-3:2007, Codes for the representation of names of languages â€“ Part 3: Alpha-3 code for comprehensive coverage of languages, is an international standard for language codes in the ISO 639 series. It defines three-letter codes for identifying languages. (source Wikipedia)

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: ISO 639-5 language family and groups codes.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: ISO 639-5:2008 "Codes for the representation of names of languagesâ€”Part 5: Alpha-3 code for language families and groups" is a highly incomplete international standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). (source Wikipedia)

label.ISO:639:3:eng: Type of subset of the country

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: World Bank countries and country groups.
World Bank geographic and administrative regions.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Level 1 and 2 geographic and administrative units.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Historic and was used in the past.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) are publicly announced standards developed by the United States federal government for use in computer systems by non-military government agencies and government contractors.

label.ISO:639:3:eng: Countries, Dependencies, and Areas of Special Sovereignty

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Federal Information Processing Standards Countries, Dependencies, and Areas of Special Sovereignty.
Federal Information Processing Standards Principal Administrative Divisions unit classes.
Federal Information Processing Standards Principal Administrative Divisions unit types.
Federal Information Processing Standards Principal Administrative Divisions types.
National Geospatial - Intelligence Agency - GEOnet Names Server.
A code that determines the equivalent characters used when generating the SORT and NO DIACRITICS (ND) feature names information rendered in Roman script.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: For a description of these codes/values, please see the "Look-up Tables..." section on the GNS Offered Services page.

label.ISO:639:3:eng: Scale range values to aid in the visualization and selection of features.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng:
The display values correspond to the following scale ranges:

  • 1 â€“ 1 - 25,999
  • 2 â€“ 26,000 - 67,999
  • 3 â€“ 68,000 - 150,999
  • 4 â€“ 151,000 - 225,999
  • 5 â€“ 226,000 - 325,999
  • 6 â€“ 326,000 - 425,999
  • 7 â€“ 426,000 - 625,999
  • 8 â€“ 626,000 - 999,999
  • 9 â€“ 1,000,000 or Smaller

example.ISO:639:3:eng:
A feature with display value of 1 should appear in a visualization client or service between scales of 1 and 25,999. It should not appear at scales of 26,000 and smaller.

A feature with display values of 1,2,3 should appear in a visualization client or service between scales of 1 through 150,999. It should not appear at scales of 160,000 and smaller.

A feature with display values of 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9 should appear in a visualization client or service at all scales.

label.ISO:639:3:eng: Countries, Dependencies, and Areas of Special Sovereignty

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Based on Open Geospatial Consortium standards.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Standardised Monitoring and Assessment of Relief and Transitions.
